application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
decision_conditions: The removal of the jetties and its platform and sheet piles that were made up for the cofferdam and abutments is the most appropriate restoration for the area as it returns the site to areas of open waterbody. This Schedule 17 Site Restoration scheme reflects the wider Schedule 17 Site Restoration Intent delivered by the approval of Groundwork South (ALJ-TP-0040 and ALJ-TP-0232) under planning application ref: 73263/APP/2022/1497 by London Borough Hillingdon and Groundwork North (ALJ-TP-0231) under planning application ref: PL/22/3611/HS2 by Buckinghamshire Council. The design is also environmentally sensitive and leaves the lakebeds in an appropriate condition. It is therefore recommended that the application be approved, in accordance with Schedule 17, Part 1, Paragraph 3, of the High Speed Rail (London - West Midlands) Act 2017.
site_name: COLNE VALLEY VIADUCT, WETLANDS ECOLOGICAL MITIGATION SITE
description: Request for approval under Schedule 17 to the High-Speed Rail (London - West Midlands) Act 2017 for a restoration agreement relating to the removal of the four temporary jetties and their associated piling platforms that were constructed parallel to the viaduct and over Harefield No.2, Savay and Korda Lakes; Long Pond and the River Colne. The restoration agreement also includes the removal of sheet piles that made up for the cofferdam and abutments in the associated lakes around piers 14-19, 20-22, 30-34 and 36-39.
